<TD WIDTH="290" STYLE="BORDER:NONE;">
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="18" STYLE="BORDER:NONE;">
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="8" STYLE="BORDER:NONE;">
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="77" STYLE="BORDER:NONE;">
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="18" STYLE="BORDER:NONE;">
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="8" STYLE="BORDER:NONE;">
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="77" STYLE="BORDER:NONE;">
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="18" STYLE="BORDER:NONE;">
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="8" STYLE="BORDER:NONE;">
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="77" STYLE="BORDER:NONE;">
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="18" STYLE="BORDER:NONE;">

<TD WIDTH="85" STYLE="BORDER:NONE;">

<TD WIDTH="7" STYLE="BORDER:NONE;">
</TD>

</TABLE>
</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<B>
<I>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Lease operating expenses.
</FONT>
</I>
</B>
	&#160; Our lease operating expenses (LOE) increased by $4.9&nbsp;million (36.4%) to $18.4&nbsp;million for the year ended 31 December&nbsp;2015 from $13.5&nbsp;million in the prior year and increased $0.93 per Boe to $6.96 per Boe from $6.03 per Boe.&#160; During 2015, certain operational changes were implemented to begin treating natural gas from a significant number of our wells in Texas so that it meets pipeline specifications and can be sold.&#160; This gas had previously been flared.&#160; The increase in LOE per BOE is primarily due to costs associated with treating the gas.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<B>
<I>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Production taxes.
</FONT>
</I>
</B>
	&#160; Our production taxes decreased by $0.9&nbsp;million (13.2%) to $6.0&nbsp;million for the year ended 31 December&nbsp;2015 from $7.0&nbsp;million for the prior year but as a percent of revenue increased to 6.7% from 4.4%. The decrease in production taxes is due to the decrease in revenue.&#160; The increase in production taxes as a percentage of revenue is primarily the result of ad valorem tax as a percentage of revenue.&#160; Texas ad valorem amounts are assessed by the counties based on estimated value of developed reserves as at 1 January&nbsp;of each year.&#160; To the extent that realized revenue pricing varies from beginning of year product prices used to assess the ad valorem amounts, the effective ad valorem rate can fluctuate significantly.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<B>
<I>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Depreciation and amortization expense, including depletion.
</FONT>
</I>
</B>
	&#160; Our depreciation and amortisation expense increased by $9.0&nbsp;million (10.5%) to $94.6&nbsp;million for the year ended 31 December&nbsp;2015 from $85.6&nbsp;million for the prior year, but decreased $2.49 per Boe to $35.66 per Boe from $38.15 per Boe.&#160; The increase reflects our increase in production, offset by a lower depletable asset base due to prior-year and mid-year impairments.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<B>
<I>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	General and administrative expenses.
</FONT>
</I>
</B>
	&#160; General and administrative expenses are comprised of employee benefits expense, including salaries and wages, and administrative expenses. Employee benefits expense increased by $4.0&nbsp;million (80%) to $8.9&nbsp;million for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015 from $5.0&nbsp;million for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014. This increase is primarily the result of higher stock-based compensation expense (non-cash) for restricted stock and options issued to directors, management and employees of $2.2 million.&#160; In addition, the amount of overhead costs capitalized decreased $7.0 million during 2015 due to the decrease in drilling activity.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	Administrative expense decreased by $2.3&nbsp;million (22%) to $8.2&nbsp;million for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015 from $10.5&nbsp;million for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014. This decrease was primarily due to a decrease in general legal and professional fees.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<B>
<I>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Impairment expense
</FONT>
</I>
</B>
	.&#160; We recorded impairment expense of $321.9 million for the year ended December&nbsp; 31, 2015 on the Company&#146;s oil and gas assets that are located in the Mississippian/Williston and the Eagle Ford as the recoverable amount was less than the carrying value primarily as a result of lower commodity pricing.&#160; See Note 19 of the Notes to the Consolidated Financial Statements for further discussion.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT 9.35PT;TEXT-INDENT:26.65PT;">
<B>
<I>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Exploration expense.
</FONT>
</I>
</B>
	&#160;The Company incurred exploration expense of $7.9 million for the year ended 31 December&nbsp;2015 on two unsuccessful exploratory wells.&#160; The Company incurred exploratory expense of $10.9 million in 2014 related to three unsuccessful exploratory wells.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<B>
<I>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Finance costs, net of interest income and amounts capitalized
</FONT>
	.
</FONT>
</I>
</B>
	&#160; Finance costs, net of amounts capitalised to exploration and development, increased by $8.7&nbsp;million to $9.4&nbsp;million for the year ended 31 December&nbsp;2015 as compared to $0.7&nbsp;million in the prior year. The increase primarily relates to additional interest incurred on a larger average outstanding debt balance and lower capitalised interest as a result of less drilling and completion activity throughout 2015.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
	48
<A NAME="A16-9801_120F_HTM_PB_48_033506_3020">
</A>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<HR SIZE="3" WIDTH="100%" NOSHADE ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="COLOR:#010101;">
</DIV>

	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<B>
<I>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Gain/(loss) on commodity hedging.
</FONT>
</I>
</B>
	&#160; The net gain (loss) on derivative financial instruments changed by $4.3&nbsp;million to a $15.3 million gain for the year ended December&nbsp; 31, 2015 as compared to the prior year. The gain on commodity hedging consisted of $2.9 million of unrealized gains on commodity derivative contracts and $12.4 million of realized gains on commodity derivative contracts.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">

<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<B>
<I>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Income taxes.&#160;
</FONT>
</I>
</B>
	The components of our provision for income taxes are as follows:

<TABLE BORDER="0" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="86%" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE;MARGIN-LEFT:.75IN;">

</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	Our combined federal and state effective tax rates differ from our statutory tax rate of 30% primarily due to
</FONT>
	an increase in unrecognised tax losses, offset by US federal and state tax rates.&#160; We expect that our effective tax rate will continue to be less than the statutory rate in 2016.&#160; See Note 7 in the Notes to the Consolidated Financial Statements of this report for further information regarding our income taxes.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<B>
<I>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Loss attributable to owners of Sundance (or net loss).
</FONT>
</I>
</B>
	&#160; Loss attributable to our owners (or net income after tax)&#160; was a net loss of $269.8&nbsp;million for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015 a decrease from net income of $15.3&nbsp;million for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014, for the reasons discussed above.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<B>
<I>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Adjusted EBITDAX.
</FONT>
</I>
</B>
	&#160; For the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015, adjusted EBITDAX was $64.8 million, or 70% of revenue, compared to $126.4 million, or 79% of revenue, from the prior year.The overall decrease in Adjusted EBITDAX was primarily driven by the decline in commodity prices.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>

	2,956
</FONT>
</P>

<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="PADDING:0IN 0IN 0IN 0IN;WIDTH:2.5%;">

</TD>

<P ALIGN="RIGHT" STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:RIGHT;">

	3,191
</FONT>

<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	107.9
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="PADDING:0IN 0IN 0IN 0IN;WIDTH:1.0%;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">

</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<B>
<I>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Barrel of oil equivalent (Boe) and average net daily production (Boe/d).
</FONT>
</I>
</B>
	&#160; Sales volume increased by 1,164,576 Boe (107.9%) to 2,243,529 Boe (6,147 Boe/d) for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014 compared to 1,078,953 Boe (2,956 Boe/d) for the prior year due to successfully bringing online 88 gross (50.1 net) producing wells primarily in the Eagle Ford and Mississippian/Woodford Formations.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	The Eagle Ford contributed 4,187 Boe/d (68.1%) of total sales volume during the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014 compared to 1,371 Boe/d (46.4%) during 2013. Mississippian/Woodford contributed 1,433 Boe/d (23.2%) of total sales volume during the year ended December&nbsp; 31, 2014 compared to 503 Boe/d (17.0%) during 2013. Our sales volume is oil-weighted, with oil representing 75% and 77% of total sales volume for the year ended December&nbsp; 31, 2014 and 2013, respectively.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<B>
<I>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Oil sales.
</FONT>
</I>
</B>
	&#160; Oil sales increased by $65.6&nbsp;million (82.7%) to $145.0&nbsp;million for the year ended December&nbsp; 31, 2014 from $79.4&nbsp;million for 2013. The increase in oil revenues was the result of increased oil production volumes ($81.3 million) offset by a decrease in product pricing ($15.7 million). Oil production volumes increased 102.4% to 1,675,078 Bbls for the year ended December&nbsp; 31, 2014 compared to 827,432&nbsp;Bbls for 2013. The average price we realized on the sale of our oil decreased by 9.8% to $86.56 per Bbl for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014 from $95.92 per Bbl for the prior year.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<B>
<I>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Natural gas sales.
</FONT>
</I>
</B>
	&#160; Natural gas sales increased by $3.4&nbsp;million (122.1%) to $6.2&nbsp;million for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014 from $2.8&nbsp;million for 2013. The increase in natural gas revenues was primarily the result of increased production volumes ($2.6 million) and improved product pricing ($0.8 million). Natural gas production volumes increased 868,800 Mcf (93.0%) to 1,803,000 Mcf for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014 compared to 934,200 Mcf for 2013. The average price we realized on the sale of our natural gas increased by 15.1% to $3.42 per Mcf for the year ended December&nbsp; 31,&#160; 2014 from $2.97 per Mcf for 2013.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<B>
<I>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	NGL sales.
</FONT>
</I>
</B>
	NGL sales increased by $5.4&nbsp;million (169.5%) to $8.6&nbsp;million for the year ended December&nbsp; 31, 2014 from $3.2&nbsp;million for the same period in 2013. The increase in NGL revenues was primarily the result of increased production volumes in the Eagle Ford and the Mississippian/Williston. NGL production volumes increased 172,131 Bbls (179.6%) to 267,952 Bbls for the year ended December&nbsp; 31, 2014 compared to 95,821 Bbls for 2013. The average price we realized on the sale of our natural gas liquids decreased by 3.6% to $32.24 per Bbl for the year ended December&nbsp; 31, 2014 from $33.45 per Bbl for 2013.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
	50
<A NAME="A16-9801_120F_HTM_PB_50_034812_141">
</A>
</P>

<HR SIZE="3" WIDTH="100%" NOSHADE ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="COLOR:#010101;">

<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="BOTTOM" BGCOLOR="#CCEEFF" STYLE="BACKGROUND:#CCEEFF;PADDING:0IN 0IN 0IN 0IN;WIDTH:1.0%;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">

	Total profit margin
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>

	18.9
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="BOTTOM" BGCOLOR="#CCEEFF" STYLE="BACKGROUND:#CCEEFF;PADDING:0IN 0IN 0IN 0IN;WIDTH:1.0%;">

</TD>
<TD WIDTH="18" STYLE="BORDER:NONE;">
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="8" STYLE="BORDER:NONE;">
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="77" STYLE="BORDER:NONE;">
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="18" STYLE="BORDER:NONE;">
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="8" STYLE="BORDER:NONE;">
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="77" STYLE="BORDER:NONE;">
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="18" STYLE="BORDER:NONE;">
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="8" STYLE="BORDER:NONE;">
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="77" STYLE="BORDER:NONE;">
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="18" STYLE="BORDER:NONE;">

</TD>

</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<B>
<I>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Lease operating expenses.
</FONT>
</I>
</B>
	&#160; Our lease operating expenses (LOE) increased by $1.4&nbsp;million (11.6%) to $13.5&nbsp;million for the year ended December&nbsp; 31, 2014 from $12.1&nbsp;million for the same period in the prior year but decreased $5.21 per Boe to $6.03 per Boe from $11.23 per Boe. The decrease in LOE per Boe is primarily due to economies of scale and the implementation of several cost saving initiatives in our field operations such as replacing contract lease operators with Company employees and reducing total field head count per well.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<B>
<I>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Production taxes.
</FONT>
</I>
</B>
	&#160; Our production taxes increased by $0.7&nbsp;million (11.2%) to $7.0&nbsp;million for the year ended&#160; December&nbsp;31, 2014 from $6.3&nbsp;million for 2013 but as a percent of revenue decreased 290 basis points to 4.4% from 7.3%. The decrease in production taxes as a percent of revenue is the result of the sale of our North Dakota and Colorado assets, which are higher production tax rate jurisdictions, and increasing our investment in Texas and Oklahoma, which are lower production tax rate jurisdictions, as well as an adjustment for lower than anticipated ad valorem taxes.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<B>
<I>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Depreciation and amortization expense, including depletion.
</FONT>
</I>
</B>
	&#160; Our depreciation and amortization expense increased by $49.4&nbsp;million (136.3%) to $85.6&nbsp;million for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014 from $36.2&nbsp;million for 2013 and increased $4.58 per Boe to $38.15 per Boe from $33.57 per Boe. The increase reflects our increase in production (107.9%), an increase in our asset base subject to amortization as a result of our acquisition and development activity, and increased completion costs caused by high-demand for completion services and a shortage of trucks able to transport frac sand and resultant higher trucking rates.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<B>
<I>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	General and administrative expenses.
</FONT>
</I>
</B>
	&#160; General and administrative expenses are comprised of employee benefits expense, including salaries and wages, and administrative expenses. Employee benefits expense decreased by $1.1&nbsp;million (19.0%) to $5.0&nbsp;million for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014 from $6.1&nbsp;million for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2013. This decrease is primarily a result of the capitalization of $4.5 million, an increase of amounts capitalized in 2013 by $1.6 million, in overhead costs, including salaries and wages, directly attributable to the exploration, acquisition and development of oil and gas properties. Included in the employee benefits expense for the fiscal year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014 is stock-based compensation expense of $1.9&nbsp;million for options issued to officers, management and employees, an increase of $0.3&nbsp;million (20.4%) compared to $1.6&nbsp;million for the twelve-month period ended December&nbsp;31, 2013.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	Administrative expense increased by $1.3&nbsp;million (15.2%) to $10.5&nbsp;million for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014 from $9.2&nbsp;million for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2013. This increase was primarily due to an increase in general legal and professional fees.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	General and administrative expenses per Boe decreased by 51.2% to $6.92 for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014 as compared to $14.18 per Boe for 2013. The decrease in general and administrative expenses per Boe is driven by increased production levels diluting fixed general and administrative costs.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<B>
<I>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Impairment expense
</FONT>
</I>
</B>
	.&#160; We recorded impairment expense of $71.2 million for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014 on the Company&#146;s development and production assets that are located in the Mississippian/Williston and the Eagle Ford as the recoverable amount was less than the carrying value primarily as a result of lower commodity pricing.&#160; No impairment was necessary on the Company&#146;s exploration and evaluation assets.&#160; See Note 17 of the Notes to the Consolidated Financial Statements for further discussion.&#160; No impairment expense was recognized in 2013.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<B>
<I>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Exploration expense.
</FONT>
</I>
</B>
	We incurred exploration expense of $10.9 million for the year ended December&nbsp; 31, 2014 on three gross (and net) unsuccessful exploratory wells in the Mississippian/Williston. The Company did not drill any unsuccessful exploratory wells in 2013.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
	51
<A NAME="A16-9801_120F_HTM_PB_51_034928_7608">
</A>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<HR SIZE="3" WIDTH="100%" NOSHADE ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="COLOR:#010101;">
</DIV>

<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<B>
<I>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Finance costs, net of interest income and amounts capitalized.
</FONT>
</I>
</B>
	&#160; Finance costs, net of amounts capitalized to exploration and development, increased by $0.7&nbsp;million to $0.5&nbsp;million for the year ended December&nbsp; 31, 2014 as compared to net interest income of $0.2&nbsp;million in 2013. The increase primarily relates to an increase in amortization of deferred financing fees and additional interest incurred on undrawn funds.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<B>
<I>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Gain/(loss) on commodity hedging.
</FONT>
</I>
</B>
	&#160; The net gain (loss) on derivative financial instruments changed by $11.6&nbsp;million to an $11.0&nbsp;million gain for the year ended December&nbsp; 31, 2014 as compared to 2013. The gain on commodity hedging consisted of $9.7 million of unrealized gains on commodity derivative contracts and $1.3 million of realized gains on commodity derivative contracts.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<B>
<I>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Income taxes.&#160;
</FONT>
</I>
</B>
	The components of our provision for income taxes are as follows:
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">

</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	Our combined federal and state effective tax rates differ from our statutory tax rate of 30% primarily due to U.S. federal and state tax rates, non-deductible expenses and the recognition of previously unrecognized tax losses. See Note 7 in the Notes to the Consolidated Financial Statements of this report for further information regarding our income taxes.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<B>
<I>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Profit attributable to owners of Sundance (or net income).
</FONT>
</I>
</B>
	&#160; Profit attributable to our owners (or net income after tax) decreased slightly by $0.6&nbsp;million (3.9%) to net income of $15.3&nbsp;million for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014 from net income of $15.9&nbsp;million for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2013, for the reason discussed above.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<B>
<I>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Adjusted EBITDAX.
</FONT>
</I>
</B>
	&#160; Adjusted EBITDAX increased by $73.8&nbsp;million (140.3%) to $126.4&nbsp;million for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014 from $52.6&nbsp;million for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2013. The overall increase in Adjusted EBITDAX was primarily driven by our production and revenue growth, while decreasing our per Boe amounts for LOE and production taxes.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT .5IN;TEXT-INDENT:-.5IN;">
<B>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	B.
</FONT>
</B>
<FONT SIZE="1" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:3.0PT;">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
<B>
	Liquidity and Capital Resources
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	Our primary sources of liquidity to date have been proceeds from strategic dispositions of low-interest non-operated oil and natural gas properties, private placements of ordinary shares, borrowings under our credit facilities and cash flows from operations. Our primary use of capital has been for the acquisition and development of oil and natural gas properties. Our future ability to grow our reserves and production will be highly dependent on the capital resources available to us.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	In May&nbsp;2015, we refinanced our previous Credit Facilities with Wells Fargo to new Credit Facilities with Morgan Stanley, increasing its total borrowing capacity from an aggregate of $135 million to $250 million; comprised of a $125 million term loan, a reserve based revolver of up to $75 million and a $50 million accordion feature.&#160; Throughout 2015, the Company increased its borrowings to $192 million ($125 million term loan and $67 million outstanding on the reserve based revolver).&#160; On December&nbsp;30, 2015, the reserve based revolver borrowing capacity was reduced from $75 million to $67 million.&#160; At year-end, the Company was fully drawn on its term loan and reserve based revolver.&#160; The $50 million accordion was available to the Company at year end, subject to certain restrictions, such as maintaining adequate proved reserve value to total debt ratio.&#160; At December&nbsp;31, 2015, we were in compliance with all of our covenants and are forecasting to remain compliant for the remainder of 2016.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	The Revolving Facility matures on May&nbsp;14, 2020 and the Term Loans mature on November&nbsp;14, 2020.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	In late 2015, management committed to a plan to sell approximately 25% non-operated working interest in our Eagle Ford assets (representing $85.4 million of the assets held for sale balance as of December&nbsp;31, 2015).&#160;
</FONT>
	Certain of the Eagle Ford assets were included in the borrowing base value under the Company&#146;s Credit Agreement.&nbsp; Upon the sale of these assets, the lender may elect to reduce the then effective borrowing base by an amount equal to the value attributed to those assets if the value of the remaining assets doesn&#146;t meet the prescribed asset coverage thresholds.&#160; At December&nbsp;31, 2015, 25% of our Eagle Ford assets represented approximately 24% of the borrowing base value so, if the valuation was unchanged at the time of the sale, the lender could elect to require repayment of that pro rata portion of the outstanding debt which equates to approximately $45 million. That being said, there many variables that affect the lender&#146;s determination of borrowing base value at any point in time and therefore it is difficult for management to estimate the borrowing base value at an undetermined point in the future so the amount that would be required to be repaid, if any, is uncertain.&#160; Accordingly, no portion of the outstanding debt has been classified as current as of December&nbsp;31, 2015.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
	52
<A NAME="A16-9801_120F_HTM_PB_52_040131_3049">
</A>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<HR SIZE="3" WIDTH="100%" NOSHADE ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="COLOR:#010101;">
</DIV>
</DIV>

<A NAME="eolPage56"></A>
<BR CLEAR="ALL" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS;">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
<A HREF="#A16-9801_120F_HTM_TABLEOFCONTENTS" TITLE="CLICK TO GO TO TABLE OF CONTENTS">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	Our 2016 capital budget is based on our operating cash flows, which we intend to use toward the development of our oil and natural gas projects, with no planned expenditures toward exploration and evaluation. We believe that our internally generated operating cash flows will be sufficient to fund our operations and planned capital expenditures for at least the next 12&nbsp;months. We may also use other sources of capital, including the issuance of debt or equity securities, to fund acquisitions or maintain our financial flexibility.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	The amount, timing and allocation of these and other future expenditures is largely discretionary. As a result, the amount of funds devoted to any particular activity may increase or decrease significantly, depending on available opportunities, timing of projects and market conditions. We expect that in the future our commodity derivative positions will help us stabilize a portion of our expected cash flows from operations despite potential declines in the price of oil and natural gas. However, should commodity prices decline for an extended period of time or the capital/credit markets become constrained, the borrowing capacity under our credit agreements could be adversely affected. In the event of a reduction in the borrowing base under our credit agreements, we may be required to prepay some or all of our indebtedness, which would adversely affect our capital expenditure program.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>

<TD WIDTH="77" STYLE="BORDER:NONE;">

<TD WIDTH="18" STYLE="BORDER:NONE;">
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="8" STYLE="BORDER:NONE;">
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="77" STYLE="BORDER:NONE;">
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="18" STYLE="BORDER:NONE;">
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="8" STYLE="BORDER:NONE;">

<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<B>
<I>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Cash flows provided by operating activities
</FONT>
</I>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	Net cash provided by operating activities for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015 decreased 50% to $64.5 million compared to the prior year. This decrease was primarily due to receipts from sales decreasing $71.0 million, or 42%, to $99.4 million primarily due to the decrease in commodity prices.&#160; This was partially offset by an increase in payments to suppliers and employees of $19.7 million.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	Net cash provided by operating activities for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014 increased 104.5% to $128.1 million compared to $62.6 million provided by operating activities for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2013. This increase was primarily due to receipts from sales increasing $85.7 million, or 101.2%, to $170.4 million, while keeping payments to suppliers and employees relatively stable with an increase of $8.2 million, or 37.7%, to $30 million.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<B>
<I>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Cash flows provided by (used in) investing activities
</FONT>
</I>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:40.5PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	Net cash used in investing activities for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015 decreased significantly to $180.8 million (including $66 million of payments related to 2014 development) as compared to $323.2 million in prior year (net of $115.3 million cash source from sale of non-current assets).&#160; This decrease is due to the Company&#146;s down-cycle development plan to drill and complete within operating cash flow.&#160; Due to the continued depressed crude oil prices, the Company expects to maintain its down-cycle development program through much of 2016.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	Net cash used in investing activities for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014 increased $158.9 million, or 96.7%, to $323.2 million. This increase is due to successful implementation of the Company&#146;s strategy to develop and grow the reserves from our high working interest, repeatable resource plays, primarily in the Eagle Ford. Due to funding available to the Company through asset sales, capital raises and credit facilities, the Company was able to accelerate a portion of its 2015 drilling program into 2014. However, due to the reduction in crude oil prices in the fourth quarter of 2014 that continued into 2015, we scaled back our drilling program to concentrate on our limited drilling obligations to hold Eagle Ford acreage during 2015.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
	53
<A NAME="A16-9801_120F_HTM_PB_53_040309_5796">
</A>
</P>

<A NAME="eolPage57"></A>
<BR CLEAR="ALL" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS;">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
<A HREF="#A16-9801_120F_HTM_TABLEOFCONTENTS" TITLE="CLICK TO GO TO TABLE OF CONTENTS">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<B>
<I>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Cash flows provided by (used in) financing activities
</FONT>
</I>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:45.35PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	Net cash provided by financing activities for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015 decreased to $50.4 million.&#160; This decrease is a result of the lower net draws on the Company&#146;s credit facilities ($62.0 million in 2015 compared to $100.0 million in prior year) and no equity raises in 2015 (compared to a net of $68.7 million in prior year).
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	Net cash provided by financing activities for the year ended December&nbsp;
</FONT>
	31, 2014 increased $123.1 million, or 277%, to $167.6 million. This increase is a result of the increased availability and draws under the Company&#146;s credit facilities and proceeds received in a private placement of shares. In February&nbsp;2014, the Company completed a private placement in which we sold 84.2 million ordinary shares at A$0.95 per share, resulting in net proceeds of approximately $68.4 million. The first tranche of 63.7 million shares was issued in March&nbsp;2014 and the second tranche of 20.5 million shares was issued in April&nbsp;2014.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<B>
<I>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Credit Facilities
</FONT>
</I>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<B>
<I>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Credit Facilities.
</FONT>
</I>
</B>
	&#160; On May&nbsp;14, 2015, we and our wholly-owned subsidiary Sundance Energy,&nbsp;Inc. entered into the Credit Agreement with Morgan Stanley Energy Capital,&nbsp;Inc., as administrative agent and the lenders from time to time party thereto, which provides for our $300 million Revolving Facility and $125 million Term Loans, with an accordion feature providing for additional term loans of up to $50 million, subject to certain conditions&#160; The Revolving Facility is subject to a borrowing base, which was set initially at $75 million and reduced to $67 million on December&nbsp;30, 2015.&#160; At December&nbsp;31, 2015, we had $125 million outstanding on the Term Loans and $67 million outstanding on the Revolving Facility.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	Interest on the Revolving Facility accrues at LIBOR plus a margin that ranges from 2.0% to 3.0% based upon the amount drawn.&#160; Interest on the Term Loans accrues at LIBOR (with a LIBOR floor of 1.0%) plus 7.0%.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	The key financial covenants of our Credit Agreement require us to (i)&nbsp;maintain a minimum current ratio, which is defined as consolidated current assets inclusive of undrawn borrowing capacity divided by consolidated current liabilities, of 1.00 or greater, (ii)&nbsp;a revolving debt to EBITDAX ratio (as defined in our Credit Agreement), determined on a rolling four quarter basis, of 4.00 to 1.00 or less, (iii)&nbsp;maintain a minimum EBITDAX to consolidated interest expense ratio of 2.00 to 1.00 or greater,&#160; and (iv)&nbsp;maintain a minimum Total Proved PV-9 (as defined in our Credit Agreement) to Total Debt (as defined in our Credit Agreement) ratio of not less than 1.25 to 1.00 for the 18 month period commencing on May&nbsp;14, 2015 and 1.50 to 1.00 at any time thereafter, in each case beginning on June&nbsp;30, 2015. The Credit Agreement requires the Company to hedge 50% of its proved developed producing forecasted volumes.&#160; In addition, our Credit Agreement contains various covenants that limit our ability to take certain actions, including, but not limited to, the following:
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT .75IN;TEXT-INDENT:-.25IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="SYMBOL" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&#183;
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE="1" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:3.0PT;">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
	incur indebtedness or grant liens on any of our assets;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT .75IN;TEXT-INDENT:-.25IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="SYMBOL" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&#183;
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE="1" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:3.0PT;">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
	enter into certain commodity hedging agreements;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT .75IN;TEXT-INDENT:-.25IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="SYMBOL" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&#183;
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE="1" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:3.0PT;">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
	sell, transfer, assign or convey assets, including a sale of all or substantially all of our assets, or engage in certain mergers or acquisitions;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT .75IN;TEXT-INDENT:-.25IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="SYMBOL" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&#183;
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE="1" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:3.0PT;">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
	make certain distributions;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT .75IN;TEXT-INDENT:-.25IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="SYMBOL" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&#183;
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE="1" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:3.0PT;">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
	make certain loans, advances and investments; and
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT .75IN;TEXT-INDENT:-.25IN;">

	&#183;
</FONT>

	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
	engage in transactions with affiliates.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	If an event of default exists under our&#160;&#160; Credit Agreement, the Agent will be able to terminate the commitments under the Credit agreement and accelerate the maturity of all loans made pursuant to the Credit Agreement and exercise other rights and remedies. Events of default include, but are not limited to, the following events:
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT .75IN;TEXT-INDENT:-.25IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="SYMBOL" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&#183;
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE="1" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:3.0PT;">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
	failure to pay any principal when due under the credit agreement;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT .75IN;TEXT-INDENT:-.25IN;">

	&#183;
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE="1" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:3.0PT;">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
	failure to pay any other obligation when due and payable within three business days after same becomes due;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT .75IN;TEXT-INDENT:-.25IN;">

	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
	failure to observe or perform any covenant, condition or agreement in the Credit Agreement or other loan documents, subject, in certain instances, to certain cure periods;
</P>

<FONT SIZE="1" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:3.0PT;">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
<B>
	Trend Information
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	We believe that oil and natural gas prices may remain volatile for the foreseeable future. While oil and/or natural gas prices are low, our future drilling and completion activity will decrease as operating cashflows decrease relative to recent historical levels. While we anticipate reductions in field service costs, material prices and all costs associated with drilling, completing and operating wells, maintaining an effective cost structure to maintain positive cashflow could be challenging. This could have a material adverse effect upon our net sales or revenues, profitability, liquidity or capital resources or cause less predictable future operating results or financial condition as compared to reported financial information. While we have identified prospects we intend to drill, our ability to grow could be adversely affected by these commodity price declines.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>

</FONT>

</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT .5IN;TEXT-INDENT:-.25IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	(1)
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE="1" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:3.0PT;">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
	Includes principal and projected interest payments due under our Revolving Facility and Term Loans.&#160; Projected interest payments are based on a 3.3% and 8.0% interest rate for the Revolving Credit Facility and the Term Loans, respectively, in effect as of December&nbsp;31, 2015. Timing above assumes credit facilities are held to maturity and that there are no subsequent changes to the borrowing base.&#160; However, if we sell the Eagle Ford assets, currently classified as
<I>
	Assets Held for Sale
</I>
	, we may be required to repay a portion of the credit facilities from the proceeds.&#160; Please read the description of our Revolving Credit Facility and our Term Loans above.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT .5IN;TEXT-INDENT:-.25IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	(2)
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE="1" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:3.0PT;">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
	The Company has capital commitments to fund exploratory drilling in the Cooper Basin (Australia) of up to approximately A$10.6 million through 2019 of which A$3.9 milion (US$2.8 million) had been incurred through December&nbsp;31, 2015 (commitment amounts in table shown in USD translated at December&nbsp;31, 2015).&#160; Timing of commitment may vary based on drilling activity by the operator.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT .5IN;TEXT-INDENT:-.25IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	(3)
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE="1" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:3.0PT;">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
	We have established a restoration provision liability for the reclamation of oil and natural gas properties at the end of their economic lives. Based on our current projections, we believe the majority of our reclamation obligations will be incurred beyond five years from December&nbsp;31, 2015.&#160; The amount shown does not include 25% of our Eagle Ford restoration provision liability, which we intend to dispose of in 2016.
</P>

<TD WIDTH="73%" VALIGN="TOP" BGCOLOR="#CCEEFF" STYLE="BACKGROUND:#CCEEFF;PADDING:0IN 0IN 0IN 0IN;WIDTH:73.16%;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	Director
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<HR SIZE="1" WIDTH="25%" NOSHADE ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="COLOR:BLACK;">
</DIV>
</EFX_NAME_AND_TITLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT .5IN;TEXT-INDENT:-.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	*
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE="1" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:3.0PT;">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
	Officers only of Sundance Energy,&nbsp;Inc.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<B>
<I>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Eric P. McCrady
</FONT>
</I>
</B>
	has been our Chief Executive Officer since April&nbsp;2011 and Managing Director of our Board of Directors since November&nbsp;2011. He also served as our Chief Financial Officer from June&nbsp;2010 until becoming Chief Executive Officer in 2011. Mr.&nbsp;McCrady has served in numerous positions in the energy, private investment and retail industries. From 2004 to 2010, Mr.&nbsp;McCrady was employed by The Broe Group, a private investment firm, in various financial and executive management positions across a variety of industry investment platforms, including energy, transportation and real estate. From 1997 to 2003, Mr.&nbsp;McCrady was employed by American Coin Merchandising,&nbsp;Inc. in various corporate finance roles. Mr.&nbsp;McCrady holds a degree in Business Administration from the University of Colorado, Boulder.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">

<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">

<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<B>
<I>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Cathy L. Anderson
</FONT>
</I>
</B>
	has been our Chief Financial Officer since December&nbsp;2011. Ms.&nbsp;Anderson has over 30&nbsp;years of experience, primarily in the oil and gas industry, and has extensive experience in budgeting and forecasting, regulatory reporting, corporate controls, and financial analysis and reporting. Prior to joining us in 2011, Ms.&nbsp;Anderson had been a consultant to companies in the oil and gas industry since 2006. Ms.&nbsp;Anderson held various positions, including Chief Financial Officer of Optigas,&nbsp;Inc., a natural gas gathering, processing and marketing company, from 2005 to 2006 and Vice President of Internal Audit and Consulting for TeleTech Holdings,&nbsp;Inc., a NASDAQ-listed global service firm providing outsourced customer management, from 2002 to 2004. From 1993 to 1999, Ms.&nbsp;Anderson was the Controller and Chief Accounting Officer of NYSE-listed Key Production Company,&nbsp;Inc. (predecessor to Cimarex Energy). She began her career in 1985 with Arthur Andersen,&nbsp;LLP. Ms.&nbsp;Anderson holds a Bachelor of Science in Business Administration with High Honors, emphasis in Accounting, from the University of Montana. She is a certified public accountant.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<B>
<I>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Grace L. Ford
</FONT>
</I>
</B>
	has served as the Chief Operating Officer of our subsidiary Sundance Energy,&nbsp;Inc. since August&nbsp;2015 and had previously served as our Vice President of Exploration and Development of our subsidiary, Sundance Energy,&nbsp;Inc. ( March&nbsp;2013 through August&nbsp;2015), and as Vice President of Geology of Sundance Energy,&nbsp;Inc. (September&nbsp;2011 through March&nbsp;2013). Prior to joining us in 2011, Ms.&nbsp;Ford served in numerous positions in the oil and gas industry, working throughout the United States and in West Africa. Ms.&nbsp;Ford&#146;s experience spans both conventional and unconventional resource exploration, development, and reservoir characterization. Ms.&nbsp;Ford has extensive operational experience in multi-rig horizontal development programs. From 2010 to 2011, Ms.&nbsp;Ford was employed as a geologist by Rock Oil, a private equity-backed company with operations in the Eagle Ford in south Texas. From 2007 to 2010, Ms.&nbsp;Ford was employed as a geoscience manager by Baytex Energy, USA, and from 2001 to 2007, Ms.&nbsp;Ford was employed as a geologist by EOG Resources,&nbsp;Inc. Prior to her tenure with EOG Resources,&nbsp;Inc., Ms.&nbsp;Ford served in various geologic or engineering capacities for Marathon Oil Company, Schlumberger and the U.S. Geological Survey. Ms.&nbsp;Ford received her PhD in Geology from the Colorado School of Mines, a Master of Science degree in Geology from the University of Arkansas and a Bachelor&#146;s of Science degree in geology from the University of Wyoming. Ms.&nbsp;Ford is a registered professional geologist in the states of Texas, Wyoming and Utah.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<B>
<I>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Mike Wolfe
</FONT>
</I>
</B>
	has been Vice President of Land of our subsidiary, Sundance Energy,&nbsp;Inc., since March&nbsp;2013 and was previously Senior Land Manager from December&nbsp;2010. He has more than 30&nbsp;years of senior land experience in the oil and gas industry. His experience encompasses all areas of land management, including field leasing, title, lease records, joint venture contracts and management of multi-rig drilling programs in numerous basins throughout the United States. From 1997 to 2010, Mr.&nbsp;Wolfe was a regional land manager for Cimarex Energy Company, a public oil and gas exploration and production company. From 1996 to 1997, he was a site acquisition agent for PacBell Mobile, a cellular phone service provider. From 1990 to 1996, he was a project landman for Capitol Oil Corporation, an oil and gas exploration and production company. From 1981 to 1990, he was an assistant land manager for TXO Production Corporation, an oil and gas exploration and production company. Prior to his tenure with TXO Production Corporation, he was a land representative for Texaco. Mr.&nbsp;Wolfe holds a Bachelor of Science degree in Business Administration, with a concentration in finance and real estate from Colorado State University.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<B>
<I>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Trina Medina
</FONT>
</I>
</B>
	has been Vice President of Reservoir Engineering of our subsidiary, Sundance Energy,&nbsp;Inc., since September&nbsp;2015.&#160; She has more than 20 years of broad reservoir engineering experience in the oil and gas industry, focused across conventional, unconventional and secondary recovery evaluation and development projects, including corporate reserves with companies such as Newfield Exploration (2007-2015), Stone Energy Corporation (2005-2007) and PDVSA INTEVEP (PDVSA E&amp;P).&#160; Ms.&nbsp;Medina received a Master of Science degree in Reservoir Engineering from Texas A&amp;M University, a Master of Science degree in Reservoir Geoscience from the Institut Francais du Petrole, and a Bachelors of Science degree in Petroleum Engineering from the Universidad Central de Venezuela.&#160; Ms.&nbsp;Medina is a member of the Society of Petroleum Engineers (SPE) and a member/reviewer for the Society of Petroleum Evaluation Engineers (SPEE).
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<B>
<I>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Michael D. Hannell
</FONT>
</I>
</B>
	has been a Director of Sundance since March&nbsp;2006 and chairman of our Board of Directors since December&nbsp;2008. Mr.&nbsp;Hannell has over 45&nbsp;years of experience in the oil and gas industry, initially in the downstream sector and subsequently in the upstream sector. His extensive experience has been in a wide range of design and construction, engineering, operations, exploration and development, marketing and commercial, financial and corporate areas in the United States, United Kingdom, continental Europe and Australia at the senior executive level with Mobil Oil (now Exxon) and Santos&nbsp;Ltd.&#160; Mr.&nbsp;Hannell has previously held a number of board appointments the most recent being the chairman of Rees Operations Pty&nbsp;Ltd (doing business as Milford Industries Pty&nbsp;Ltd), an Australian automotive components and transportation container manufacturer and supplier; And&#160; the chairman of Sydac Pty&nbsp;Ltd, a designer and producer of simulation training products for industry.&#160; Mr.&nbsp;Hannell has also served on a number of not-for-profit boards, with appointments as president of the Adelaide-based Chamber of Mines and Energy, president of Business&nbsp;SA (formerly the South Australian Chamber of Commerce and Industry), chairman of the Investigator Science and Technology Centre, chairman of the Adelaide Graduate School of Business, and a member of the South Australian Legal Practitioners Conduct Board. Mr.&nbsp;Hannell holds a Bachelor of Science degree in Engineering (with Honors) from the University of London and is a Fellow of the Institution of Engineers Australia.
</P>
